<title level="1" right="Action">[Wind them Up](/Actions.aspx?ID=1456) <actions string="Two Actions" /></title>

<traits>
<trait label="Gunslinger" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=406" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Impossible Lands](/Sources.aspx?ID=146) pg. 108</row>

</column>

---

Should foes parry your blade or dodge your bullets? Neither— they should be watching their purse. Make a melee Strike with your [combination](/Traits.aspx?ID=417) weapon, and then attempt a [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) check with a –5 penalty to [Steal](/Actions.aspx?ID=68) from your target; you can't Steal closely guarded objects or objects that would take a long time to pilfer. You don't need a free hand to attempt to Steal something in this manner. If your Thievery check succeeds, the target is [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) against your ranged attacks until the start of your next turn, and you don't trigger reactions that are normally triggered by movement or a ranged attack. These effects occur even if your target has no objects to Steal.
name: Wind them Up
